configurer.registerGlobalAction(ActionFactory.NEXT_PART.create(window));      
configurer.registerGlobalAction(ActionFactory.PREVIOUS_PART.create(window));

This probably isn't entirely clear, but there is an extra step you need to 
take.  Please see the javadoc for "ActionFactory.linkCycleActionPair()",  
"ActionFactory.NEXT_PART" and "ActionFactory.PREVIOUS_PART".  You need to link 
the cycle action pair. 
 
I'm not sure why we don't just link these automatically. 
 
Nick: Is there any reason why the linking step is not done automatically?

Yes, after calling ActionFactory.linkCycleActionPair(), I was able to make the
actions work properly. Thank you.

(In reply to comment #1)
> Nick: Is there any reason why the linking step is not done automatically? 

The actions aren't actually created until the factories' create methods are
called.  I suppose we could have factory methods that creates them in linked pairs.

I'm just going to close this bug, as it's not clear how to make this any 
easier without sacrificing configurability.
